# Drone News 48h Brief — February 01, 2026

_Window: last 48 hours; 28 incidents._

## Summary
In the past 48 hours, a pattern of drone incidents has emerged primarily surrounding issues of smuggling and public safety. Notably, a Connecticut man was sentenced to nine years for smuggling drugs into a prison using drones. Concurrently, concerns were raised at Strangeways prison regarding challenges in installing anti-drone grilles on historical structures. The police in Perak made arrests related to unauthorized drone use and weapon possession during a religious festival. These incidents highlight ongoing security challenges, particularly in relation to prisons and drug trafficking, while authorities are also expanding counter-drone measures. Noteworthy are substantial regulatory changes, such as the FAA's temporary bans on drones near NFL stadiums for the Super Bowl. International implications were noted with Israeli drone strikes reported in southern Lebanon, indicating an escalation in drone-related military actions.

**By category:** airport: 2 • arrest: 1 • crash: 7 • other: 12 • smuggling: 5 • terrorism: 1
**Top queries:** drone crash (6), drone incident (5), unauthorized drone (5), drone smuggling (4), drone arrest (3)
